page.title: 15GODMERSHAM ECOLOGY
page.content: This valley is designated an area of outstanding natural beauty. The Stour flows through fertile farmland a relatively well oxygenated, unpolluted trout river. Shallow open banks grow the rare Oenanthe fluviatalis (River Dropwort) and a local dragonfly, the Caleopterys splendens flits above. Near Chilham a 13C heronry still exists. Thin flinty soil covers the valley sides crowned with ancient woodland. Small areas of rough chalkland pasture still survive, supporting a rich chalkland flora and fauna. Local orchids include the Bee, Butterfly, and Lady orchid. Duke of Burgundy, Green Hairstreak and Chalk Blue butterflies can be found. Godmersham Downs is the only known inland site for the Roesel's bush cricket,normally a coastal species.
